channel.title: Review on Poryland
channel.description: Recent content in Review on Poryland

item.title: The Capture - by Kathryn Lasky
item.description: The Capture is a very intense book. It’s about family of owls, but the older brother of this family, Kludd, does not like Soren or Eglantine, his two younger siblings. So, Kludd shoves Soren out of his nest, and Soren gets “snatched ” by St.

item.title: Eggs - by Jerry Spinelli
item.description: I really liked Eggs, a book about a boy who lost his mother, but changes when he gains a new friend. At first, David seemed so disagreeable, but later, because of Spinelli’s ability to keep a question of “Why?

item.title: Gabriel's Horses
item.description: Gabriel’s Horses is the first book of the Racing To Freedom trilogy. Summary: Gabriel and his father are slaves. He overtakes a race, but then finds out that his father has enlisted in the Union army and won’t be with Gabriel and his mother.

item.title: A Review of Where The Mountain Meets The Moon
item.description: This story is full of hope and adventure. I like that this is not a no-problem story. I also like that there is never an obvious solution to the problems.

item.title: A Review of The Trumpet of the Swan_ by E.B.White
item.description: This story is very heartwarming and endearing. Summary: Two swans give birth to 5 cygnets, including one that has speech defect. His name is Louis.Then Louis falls in love with a beautiful swan by the name of Serena.

item.title: Keena Ford
item.description: Keena Ford goes to second grade and wrote down the date wrong. Her teacher, Mrs.Campbell, mistakes her birthday for another date! What is Keena going to do now? Read the book to find out.

item.title: The Talented Clementine
item.description: The Talented Clementine, by Sara Pennypacker and illustrated by Marla Frazee Clementine thinks she has no talent when there is a talent show! Magaret tried to help her in tap dancing, but she could not.
